title: Richard M. Daley
summary: Richard Michael Daley (born April 24, 1942) is an American politician who served as the 54th[1] Mayor of Chicago, Illinois, from 1989 to 2011. Daley was elected mayor in 1989 and was reelected five times until declining to run for a seventh term. At 22 years, his was the longest tenure in Chicago mayoral history, surpassing the 21-year stay of his father, Richard J. Daley.
